fuel.title: Fuel

texts.title: Amount
texts.name: amount
texts.desc: Amount of fuel used in the unit of measure specified above.

texts.title: End Date
texts.name: date
texts.desc: E.g., if the bill covers electricity from 1st January to 31st January, the end date is 31st January. This is NOT the same as the date the bill is sent out/received or invoice date.

fuel.ins: Enter the amount of energy used at each site of operation. Copies of utility bills can be linked in the 'Additional Data' section to the right.

cars.title: Cars

texts.title: Do you know the amount of fuel used?
texts.name: q1
texts.desc: To enter the kWhs from electric vehicles please enter this in the electricity tab.

texts.title: Type of Fuel / Vehicle (By Size)
texts.name: type
texts.desc: If you answered 'yes' to the previous question, select the type of fuel used by the vehicle. If you answered 'no', select the size of the vehicle used. Guidance on vehicle sizes can be found in the FAQs.

texts.title: Vehicle Fuel Type
texts.name: columntext
texts.desc: Select the type of fuel used by the vehicle.

texts.title: Distance
texts.name: distance
texts.desc: Distance travelled in the unit of measure specified above.

texts.title: Amount
texts.name: amount
texts.desc: Amount of fuel used in the unit of measure specified above.

cars.ins: We recommend entering details for each individual vehicle, unless multiple Vehicles are the same size and fuel type. Alternatively, if you know the total fuel used, you can use this instead.

freighting.title: Freighting

texts.title: Whole Vehicle
texts.name: wholev
texts.desc: Are you the sole user, or need to account for the whole vehicle capacity?

texts.title: Ownership
texts.name: ownership
texts.desc: Is the freighting vehicle owned by your company, or outsourced?

texts.title: GHG Definition
texts.name: streamtype
texts.desc: If your company has paid for the transport directly, it is upstream; if they have not, it is downstream.

freighting.ins: Enter details for all lorry, rail, sea, and air freight that has taken place. You can enter journeys individually or by using the sum of all journeys in the relevant period.

waste.title: Waste

texts.title: Weight
texts.name: amount
texts.desc: Provide the weight of waste in the specified unit of measure.

waste.ins: Enter details for waste produced from company operations. If the waste disposal method is unknown, assume landfill, and make note of this in the comment box.

flight.title: Flights
flight.ins: If you know the destination and departure airports, use the 'select airports' option. If you only have air miles travelled, use 'enter distances', and if the air miles total is from all employees, enter the 'number of passengers' as 1.

other_travels.title: Public Transport
other_travels.ins:
Enter details for all taxi, bus, rail, and ferry travel.
For taxis: passenger.km or passenger.mile should be used when single passengers are travelling, while km is used to account for the whole vehicle, so is more suitable if multiple passengers travel in the same vehicle.

electricity.title: Electricity

texts.title: End Date
texts.name: date
texts.desc: E.g., if the bill covers electricity from 1st January to 31st January, the end date is 31st January. This is NOT the same as the date the bill is sent out/received or invoice date.

texts.title: Supplier Specific Emissions Factor
texts.name: supplier_factors
texts.desc: Enter the supplier-specific electricity emissions factor (in gCO2e/kWh). This may be provided by the supplier. If you are on a fully renewable energy tariff, enter 0.

electricity.ins: Enter the amount of electricity used at each site of operation, electric vehicle kWhs can also be entered here. Copies of utility bills can be linked in the 'Additional Data' section to the right. Any electric cars not already covered by your site electricity can be added here.

heatandsteam.title: Heat and Steam

texts.title: End Date
texts.name: date
texts.desc: E.g., if the bill covers electricity from 1st January to 31st January, the end date is 31st January. This is NOT the same as the date the bill is sent out/received or invoice date.

texts.title: Is the heat and steam generated onsite or is it district heat and steam?
texts.name: q1

heatandsteam.ins: Enter the amount of electricity used at each site of operation, electric vehicle kWhs can also be entered here. Copies of utility bills can be linked in the 'Additional Data' section to the right. Any electric cars not already covered by your site electricity can be added here.

water.title: Water

texts.title: Waste %
texts.name: waste%
texts.desc: What percentage of water used is returned to the sewage system as wastewater? (This is usually 95-100% - if left blank, it is assumed 100%)

texts.title: Code
texts.name: code
texts.desc: For internal testing

water.ins: Enter the amount of water used at each site. Some suppliers will include the waste percentage in their bills.

home_workers.title: Home Workers

texts.title: Occupancy
texts.name: occupancy
texts.desc: Single = during working hours, there is no one else in the employee's home (so if they weren't working from home, the house would be unoccupied). Multiple = there are other people in the employee's home during working hours.

home_workers.ins: If multiple staff have the same homeworking data (e.g., they all work two days a week for the same hours), you can add all of them at once using the 'number of workers' box.

hotel.title: Hotel Stays
hotel.ins: To work out 'number of guest nights', multiply the number of employees staying at the hotel by the number of nights stayed.

commuting.title: Commuting
commuting.ins: Enter the type of vehicle and distance of employee commuting. Any employees that walk or cycle can be excluded as these produce zero emissions.

bulk_materials.title: Bulk Materials
bulk_materials.ins: Enter details of any raw materials that have been purchased in bulk by your company.

refrigerator.title: Refrigerants
refrigerator.ins: Refrigerant gases are most commonly used in air conditioning systems. Be sure to only enter data on gas top-ups/refills, rather than e.g., the capacity of the unit.

product.title: Product

texts.title: Transport Emissions per unit
texts.name: em_dist
texts.desc: Raw material transport & internal transport (e.g., between manufacturing sites).

texts.title: Distribution Emissions per unit
texts.name: em_dist_cust
texts.desc: Distribution of the product to customers

texts.title: Usage Emissions
texts.name: em_use
texts.desc: E.g., electricity used to power the product, if necessary

product.ins: If you have LCAs of any products produced by your company, enter this data here.

additional.title: Custom

texts.title: Does this have WTT emissions?
texts.name: q1
texts.desc: WTT = well-to-tank

texts.title: GHG Category
texts.name: ghg
texts.desc: According to the GHG Protocol

texts.title: GHG WTT
texts.name: ghgwtt
texts.desc: Greenhouse Gas Well-to-Tank

additional.ins: If you already have direct emissions data, you can enter this here.

spending.title: Spend

texts.title: SIC Database
texts.name: sic_uk
texts.desc: Use DEFRA as a default, ONS is for legacy clients only

spending.ins: Enter details of company expenses, categorised by either SIC (UK) or NAICS (USA). To avoid double-counting, don't include anything that has already been covered by other categories,  e.g., expenses from business travel.

paper.title: Paper

texts.title: GSM
texts.name: gsm
texts.desc: Grams per square metre. Typical paper is 80.

paper.ins: Enter details of all paper purchased by your company.
